thread.title: S.C. traffic bust finds mobile abortion clinic: sheriff
thread.title_full: S.C. traffic bust finds mobile abortion clinic: sheriff - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: S.C. traffic bust finds mobile abortion clinic: sheriff
text:
Matthew Valentine/Getty Images/iStockphoto A traveling abortionist arrested in South Carolina was found with drugs and blood- and tissue-covered tools but no medical license, authorities said. A mobile abortion clinic, with blood- and tissue-covered tools, was discovered during a four-day traffic bust in South Carolina, authorities said.
"Basically, we got an illegal baby killer," Spartanburg County Sheriff Chuck Wright said at a press conference Friday while announcing the gruesome find.
Though the traveling abortionist was found with plenty of drugs and used tools, he had no medical license, Wright said.
"These people run a risk of dying from infection and not having the medical stuff that they need," he warned of the man’s clients.
His arrest — along with his wife's for intent to distribute marijuana — was among 27 made during the county's recent annual sting.
FOX Carolina 21 Nearly 90 vehicles were searched during Operation Rolling Thunder.
That led to the additional discovery of about 30 pounds of marijuana, 305 cartons of cigarettes, more than $39,500 in currency, as well as cocaine, methamphetamines, narcotic sedative GHB and heroin, authorities said.
